snippet: The bombing near the northern city of Aleppo appeared to be part of an effort by the Syrian insurgency to regain momentum after a series of defeats.
abstract: Syrian rebels mount one of deadliest strikes against government forces to date, sending a suicide bomber near city of Aleppo to detonate six tons of explosives in a truck and killing as many as 60 soldiers; bombing reflects efforts by some rebel contingents to counter series of advances by government forces in recent weeks.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Fares Akram from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: The bombing near the northern city of Aleppo appeared to be part of an effort by the Syrian insurgency to regain momentum after a series of defeats.

headline.main: Large Truck Bomb Reported to Kill 60 Syrian Troops
headline.print_headline: Large Truck Bomb Reported to Kill 60 Syrian Troops
